clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarkers of Acute Kidney Injury in Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Biomarkers in Estimation for Risk of Acute Kidney Injury in Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is the most common complication in patients after cardiac surgery. An usual estimation of risk for AKI is estimation of serum creatinine, which is unreliable indicator of AKI risk. Because of that, today different biomarkers are investigated to predict incidence for development AKI after cardiac surgery. This investigation will try to find potentially risk patients for developing AKI after cardiac surgery by using conventional markers (creatinine, glomerular filtration rate) in perioperative period comparing with two different biomarkers neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL) and growth differentiation factor 15 (GDF-15) which are proven markers in patients with increased risk for AKI development.

primary_outcome.measure: Consecutive values of neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL)
primary_outcome.description: By the changing of NGAL values in consecutive measuring, predict which patients are in increased risk for development of AKI

primary_outcome.measure: Consecutive values of growth differentiation factor 15 (GDF-15)
primary_outcome.description: By the changing of GDF-15 values in consecutive measuring, predict which patients are in increased risk for development of AKI

primary_outcome.measure: Consecutive values of glomerular filtration rate (GFR)
primary_outcome.description: By the changing of GFR values in consecutive measuring, predict which patients are in increased risk for development of AKI

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for cardiac surgery with usage of cardiopulmonary bypass

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients scheduled for cardiac surgery (CABG, valve replacement/repair, combined)
- older than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous known renal disease
- patients on chronic dialysis
